section.name: Introduction
section.p: The JES Server provides an environment for scripts to execute in that is configured with some pre-initialized objects. These objects can be used to gain information and interfact with the current state of the workflow, the Jes Server, and other Astrogrid components.

tr.td: A client side interface for the CommonExecutionConnector .
A simple factory for creating CommonExecutionConnector Client delegates.
A bean to hold what is passed in the "community snippet".
Defines the methods that a Configurator must implement.
provides an interface for executing groovy scripts in rulebase to call back into jes server also provides some 'helper' methods that can be called from scripts to create usefule objects, etc.
represents set of variable bindings in scope.
Implememtation of standard log interface, but logs messages to workflow document.
Implementation of activity keys for the new workflow object model
Description of an application
A little container object, that contains some interesting suymmary info about an application.
A component that queries a registry for information about applications.
A component that can execute and manage jobs
Thrown when a tool instance does not match the definition given in an application description.
A component of methods to help build workflow documents
Catch all exception type for things that go wrong with the workflow interface.
Container object that collects the various components used to interact with workflows.
A component that can store and retreive workflow documents (i.e.
Class Name: RegistryAdminService Description: This class represents the client webservice delegate to the Administration piece of the web service.
Class Name: RegistryAdminService Description: This class represents the client webservice delegate to the Administration piece of the web service.
The QueryRegistry class is a delegate to a web service that submits an XML formatted registry query to the to the server side web service also named the same RegistryService.
The RegistryService class is a delegate to a web service that submits an XML formatted registry query to the to the server side web service also named the same RegistryService.
hellper methods for working with IO.
Class to help construction of various kinds of object
Extension of the standard StarTableFactory that also allows star tables to be contructed from ExternalValues encourages factory to build random-access tables by dfault - less surprising then.
A helper class that wraps an ExternalValue as a Datasource - acts as a bridge between the Astrogrid and Starlink worlds.
a helper class that wraps a string as a datasource
Top-level container object for delegates, helper objects and libraries useful for working with astrogrid.
helper methods for working with xml.
International Virtual Observatory Resource Name.
Representation of a container in an Astrogrid Store.
Representation of a File in an Astrogrid Store
A wrapper for the AstroGrid StoreFile to make it easier to integrate into Aladin.
An adapter to enable Aladin to access files in AstroGrid MySpace.

This delegate provides methods for operating on files in VoSpace - that is, files that are on store points (accessible through StoreClient implementations) that are Registered in IVO Registries and/or Communities.
The abstract base class of all activities that can be performed in a workflow
Abstract base class of activities that contain other activities
Action to take when an error occurs in the wrapped try block variable specified by 'var' attribute will contain details of the error.
Branch to take when if condition evaluates to false
basic type for execution records
A string 'buffer' for holding further information, keyed by attribute - so execution record becomes a map.
A record of a single execution of a job
unique identifier for job executions
A record of a single execution of a job step
a collection of activities to be performed potentially in parallel
A for loop construct - iterated over a sequence of items
An if statement
the list of input parameters
the list of output paramters
A parallel-for loop construct - executes the loop body on each element of items in parallel
create a new workflow-variable scope for its body.
a step in the workflow - execute some script statements.
a collection of activities to be performed sequentially
Declare (and optionally initialize) a new workflow variable, or update value of existing variable
a step of the workflow - call to an external CEA application.
Branch to take when if condition evaluates to true
represents a call to a CEA application
Error-handling construct.
forget a previously-declared workflow variable
A while loop construct
Base element of an Astrogird workflow document, conforming to the schema defined for namespace http://www.astrogrid.org/schema/AGWorkflow/v1

section.name: Toolbox
section.p: The main class for interacting with the astrogrid is Toolbox. An instance of this class, named astrogrid is available in the JEScript environment. Other subsidiary helper objects and delegates are accessible by calling the methods on Toolbox

hellper methods for working with IO.
would have liked to just extend piper - but has no public constructor.

p.comment: A bean to hold what is passed in the "community snippet". Note that the current interpretation of this is that the account contains an identifier of the form user@community - The group relates to the group that the user wishes to use for its credentials, this may be a cross community group. note that this should really be merged with the @link org.astrogrid.community.common.util.CommunityMessage class, which effectively does xml deserializtion (should be deprecated From iteration 5 - use @link org.astrogrid.community.beans.v1.Credentials, but may still be needed)

td.p: Checks to see if this user refers to the same account as the given user
Return the community part of the account string
Returns will return null if the account is null or the community part does not exist - i.e. there is no @ in the string.
gets the userid part of the account string - i.e. that before the @
Create a "community snippet" from this User.
Returns The XML string that is the community snippet.
Returns a string with the 'normal' representation of account@community

p.comment:
Defines the methods that a Configurator must implement. Also provides many of the convenience methods, such as getUrl().
There is no store yet but we could add this later
NB - Have deliberately NOT included a loadStream(Stream) method - although this might be generically useful, it makes it difficult to track through the Config package where properties have come from. If you need to do this, write your stream of properties to a file and then load from File.toURL()

td.p: Writes out the configuration keys and values to the given Writer. Used for site debugging. Remember that passwords should be hidden...
Attempt to resolve deployment-specific name. In this case it looks at the url of this file
Indirect typed getProperty - returns a DOM loaded from a file at the url speficied. ie, looks up the given key to get a url, then attempts to read a DOM from the file at that URL.
Indirect typed getProperty - returns a DOM loaded from a file at the url speficied. ie, looks up the given key to get a url, then attempts to read a DOM from the file at that URL.
Indirect typed getProperty - returns a DOM loaded from a file at the url speficied. ie, looks up the given key to get a url, then attempts to read a DOM from the file at that URL.
Typed getProperty - returns integer. If property is not a valid int, throws a wrapping ConfigException as a runtime error
Typed getProperty - returns integer. If property is not a valid int, throws a wrapping ConfigException as a runtime error
Returns the property identified by the given key. If the property is not found, throws a PropertyNotFoundException
Returns the property identified by the given key. If the property is not found, returns the given defaultValue
Typed getProperty - returns URL. If property is not a valid url, throws a wrapping ConfigException as a runtime error
Typed getProperty - returns URL. If property is not a valid url, throws a wrapping ConfigException as a runtime error
Returns a list of the keys
Loads the properties from the file at the given URL
Returns information about where the values are being found
Resolves environment variables. Looks for ${xxxx} strings and replace with whatever xxxx is set to in the system environment properties

There are several occasions when an application needs a complete file. For example, a metadata file. This method provides a way of locating that file in different environments. If the filename includes a ${..} then the contents of the brackets are resolved using the system properties. This allows us to make use of Tomcat's locations for example. If the filename is then absolute, the file is resolved normally. If the filename is relative, the file is searched for first in the classpath then in the working directory. If the path is not found, a FileNotFoundException is thrown listing the places looked. If the path is found, a url to it is returned. Hmm not sure if this is really a Configuration thing.... NB this resolves to a URL so it won't find files in jar files
Set property. Stores in cache so it overrides all other properties with the same key.

section.name: JES Server
section.p: The JesInterface class gives access into some of the internals of the current JES server. An instance of this class named jes is available in the JEScript environment. The JesInterface class in turn extends WorkflowLogger, and so inherits it's methods too.
The Vars class contains a set of variable bindings. An instance called vars is available in JEScript environment, and contains all the variables currently set.

p.comment: provides an interface for executing groovy scripts in rulebase to call back into jes server also provides some 'helper' methods that can be called from scripts to create usefule objects, etc. Maybe these should be split into a libraru class, and a JesServerINterface class.

code.nobr: dispatchScript(java.lang.String id, org.astrogrid.jes.jobscheduler.impl.groovy.JesShell shell, org.astrogrid.jes.jobscheduler.impl.groovy.ActivityStatusStore map, java.util.Map rules)
dispatchStep(java.lang.String id, org.astrogrid.jes.jobscheduler.impl.groovy.JesShell shell, org.astrogrid.jes.jobscheduler.impl.groovy.ActivityStatusStore states, java.util.Map rules)

td.p: dispatach a tool step to a cea server for execution.

ul.li: id - the identifier of the step to execute

code.nobr: executeSet(java.lang.String id, org.astrogrid.jes.jobscheduler.impl.groovy.JesShell shell, org.astrogrid.jes.jobscheduler.impl.groovy.ActivityStatusStore map, java.util.Map rules)

td.p: access object in workflow tree by id
return list of steps in the workflow document
the workflow object the script belongs to
create a new initialized parameter object
records most important events back into main workflow document.

p.comment: represents set of variable bindings in scope. allows additional scopes to be added and removed. scopes introduce new bindings. asignements to existing bindings in parent scopes update, rather than shadow.

td.p: Add the variables defined in this collection to a binding, plus the 'vars' object itself.
Branch these vars this is a very shallow copy. existing scopes are shared between the original and copy. however, new scopes in the copy do not appear in the original.
Returns true if this Vars is the same as the o argument.
Returns true if this Vars is the same as the o argument.

Find the variables defined in this collection in the binding, copy back across again. any new variables defined in the script must have been done directly - through accessing this object already. so just need to look for the values of existing vars.

p.comment: Implememtation of standard log interface, but logs messages to workflow document.

td.p: log a debug message to both the main record and a step record.

section.name: Workflow Delegate
section.p: These classes provide a high-level interface to the Astrogrid workflow system. They provide methods for building workflows, loading and saving to VOSpace, querying registry for cea applications, and submitting workflows to JES for execution.

p.comment: Implementation of activity keys for the new workflow object model

td.p: create a key for the current position in a workflow

ul.li: current object to create activity key for

td.p: Returns activity key that points to the current object.

ul.li: IllegalArgumentException - if root or current is null, or current is not within the workflow object tree

td.p: Returns true if this ActivityKey is the same as the o argument.
Returns true if this ActivityKey is the same as the o argument.
apply the activity key to a document, to access the object it refers to
Returns the object in the tree that the activity key pointed to, or null if no object was found
construct a new, initialized tool from the default (first) interface in the application descriptor
construct a new, initialized tool from an interface in this application descriptor

ul.li: intf the interface to create a tool instance from
IllegalArgumentException if the interface does not belong to this application description.

td.p: from a definition of a parameter, create a new, initialized parameter value.
Returns a parameter value with name, type initialized. if defn provides a defaultValue, this is set as content

interfaces contain a bunch of 'ParameterRef' objects, that reference 'BaseParameterDefinitions' that are defined elsewhere, and give the type, user interface description, etc of the paramter. This method will get a definition for a parameter reference

ul.li: parameterRef the reference to look up
IllegalArgumentException when asked to find definition for a reference that is not in the application description.

td.p: convenience method to get a parameter definition for a parameter value. equivalent to getDefinitionForReference(getReferenceForValue(p,i))
access the xml of the original registry entry that defines this Application
Returns dom of registry entry. may be null; if not, root element will be <VODescription>
find the parameter reference assocuated with a parameter value in a particular interface

verify that a tool object matches what is expected by the application (as defined by this descriptor) at moment, checks against information in the application description. in future, could access web services to resolve ucds, or check url parameters, etc.

p.comment: A little container object, that contains some interesting suymmary info about an application.

td.p: array of the interface names for this application

p.comment: A component that queries a registry for information about applications.

Returns an description of the application

ul.li: WorkflowtInterfaceException if an error occurs - i.e. if the application is not found

td.p: list system names and user-friendly names of applications.

p.comment: A component that can execute and manage jobs

Returns workflow document, plus annotations. never null

ul.li: WorkflowInterfaceException if job cannot be submitted

A component of methods to help build workflow documents

ul.li: creds credentials for this workflow - contains account, group and authentication token for the user this workflow is going to run as.
name name of the new workflow
description a textual description of the workflow

td.p: Returns a new workflow document object, that is schema-valid. never null

p.comment: Catch all exception type for things that go wrong with the workflow interface.
Container object that collects the various components used to interact with workflows.

td.p: get a component to manage jobs - executoions of workflows. never null
get a component to query a registry. never null
get a component to build workflows. never null
get a component to access a store. never null

p.comment: A component that can store and retreive workflow documents (i.e. myspace)

section.name: Registry Delegate
section.p: Delegates to query and adminsister a registry

p.comment: Class Name: RegistryAdminService Description: This class represents the client webservice delegate to the Administration piece of the web service. It uses the same Interface as the server side webservice so they both implement and handle the same web service method names. The primary goal of this class is to establish a Axis-Message style webservice call to the server.

td.p: Takes an XML Document to send to the update server side web service call. Establishes a service and a call to the web service and call it's update method, using an Axis-Message style. Then updates this document onto the registry.

ul.li: query Document a XML document dom object to be updated on the registry.

td.p: Returns the document updated on the registry is returned.

p.comment: Class Name: RegistryAdminService Description: This class represents the client webservice delegate to the Administration piece of the web service. It uses the same Interface as the server side webservice so they both implement and handle the same web service method names. The primary goal of this class is to establish a Axis-Message style webservice call to the server.

td.p: Takes an XML Document to send to the update server side web service call. Establishes a service and a call to the web service and call it's update method, using an Axis-Message style. Then updates this document onto the registry.

ul.li: query Document a XML document dom object to be updated on the registry.

td.p: Returns the document updated on the registry is returned.

p.comment: The QueryRegistry class is a delegate to a web service that submits an XML formatted registry query to the to the server side web service also named the same RegistryService. This delegate helps the user browse the registry and also the OAI.

p.comment: The RegistryService class is a delegate to a web service that submits an XML formatted registry query to the to the server side web service also named the same RegistryService. This delegate helps the user browse the registry. Queries should be formatted according to the schema at IVOA schema version 0.9. This class also uses the common RegistryInterface for knowing the web service methods to call on the server side.

code.nobr: listIdentifiers(java.lang.String metadataPrefix, java.util.Date fromDate, java.util.Date untilDate)

section.name: VoSpace Delegate
section.p: Two interfaces for interacting with VoSpace

p.comment:
International Virtual Observatory Resource Name. Used to name specific IVO resources.
They act as keys to VO Registries; give the registry an IVORN and it will return the associated VOResource document
Ivorns are of the form: ivo://something/anything/athing/etc#somethingwithmeaningtothiscontext
For example:
ivo://roe.ac.uk/storee#path/to/file.ext might resolve to an FTP server, on which the path 'path/to/file.ext' would locate a document.
Ivorns are immutable - ie once created, they cannot be changed. You can make new ones out of old ones.
This is a badly named package. IVORNs can be used for things other than stores...

td.p: Returns ivo id without the scheme. eg 'ivo://roe.ac.uk/mch/myspace' returns 'roe.ac.uk/mch/myspace'
Returns true if the given string is likely to be an ivorn - ie if it starts with ivo://
Representation to be used when submitting the IVORN to a registry to be resolved

p.comment:
This delegate provides methods for operating on files in VoSpace - that is, files that are on store points (accessible through StoreClient implementations) that are Registered in IVO Registries and/or Communities.
Note that there is a difference between the user (termed operator here) of this class, and the owner of the files that might be being browsed.

td.p: Creates a new user (identified by the given user ivorn) on the storepoint given by the 'target' Ivorn.
Returns a StoreClient delegate for the given ivorn for direct file manipulation
Returns the StoreFile representation of the file at the given AGSL
Returns the user of this delegate - ie the account it is being used by
Gets a file's contents as a stream

code.nobr: putBytes(byte[] bytes, int offset, int length, org.astrogrid.store.Ivorn targetIvorn, boolean append)

td.p: Puts the given byte buffer from offset of length bytes, to the given target
Streaming output - returns a stream that can be used to output to the given location

code.nobr: putUrl(java.net.URL source, org.astrogrid.store.Ivorn targetIvorn, boolean append)

td.p: Copies the contents of the file at the given source url to the given location

p.comment: Representation of a container in an Astrogrid Store.

ul.li: TreeClientDuplicateException If the file already exists.
TreeClientServiceException If the service is unable to handle the request.

td.p: Get a list (collection) of the current child nodes. Note, you cannot add a child node by adding a node to the collection.
Returns An unmodifiable collection of Node(s) for the child nodes.

p.comment: Representation of a File in an Astrogrid Store

td.p: Get an InputStream to read data from the file.

ul.li: TreeClientServiceException If the service is unable to handle the request.

td.p: Get the mime type for the file.
Returns The mime type for the file contents, or null if is not set..

ul.li: TreeClientServiceException If the service is unable to handle the request.

td.p: Get an OutputStream to send data to the file. Openning a new stream to an existing file will over-write the file contents. The client MUST close the output stream to force the transfer to complete.

ul.li: TreeClientServiceException If the service is unable to handle the request.

p.comment: A wrapper for the AstroGrid StoreFile to make it easier to integrate into Aladin.

td.p: Check if this represents a container.
Returns true if this represents a container.
Check if this represents a file.
Returns true if this represents a file.

p.comment: An adapter to enable Aladin to access files in AstroGrid MySpace.

td.p: Get the root node of the account home space.
Returns An AladinAdapterContainer representing the root of the account myspace.

ul.li: TreeClientSecurityException If the adapter is not logged in.
TreeClientServiceException If unable to handle the request.

td.p: Access to the current security token.
Returns The current security token, or null if not logged in.

ul.li: ivorn The 'ivo://...' identifier for the AstroGrid account.
TreeClientServiceException If unable to handle the request.
TreeClientServiceException If unable to handle the request.

section.name: CEA Delegate
section.p: These classes provide a low-level interface to interact with CEA servers.

p.comment: A client side interface for the {@link CommonExecutionConnector}. This interface uses castor objects derived from the schema instead of the axis ones.

ul.li: executionId the identifier for the execution instance that is to be aborted.
executionId the id of the application to start

td.p: Returns true if execution was started successfully
retrieve summary information for an applicatin execution - this structure contains input parameters, results, plus execution status.

ul.li: executionId the identifier for the instance to query.

td.p: access the results of an application execution

ul.li: executionId the identifier for the execution instance to query

td.p: Initialize an application asynchronously. The application may be a command line application, a data query or another web service depending on the type of Common Execution Controller that is being contacted.

ul.li: tool This is the specification of the application that will be run.
jobstepID An identifier that the caller can use to keep track of this particular execution instance.
jobMonitorURL The endpoint of a JobMonitor service that should be called back when the execution has finished.

td.p: Returns An identifier that the CommonExecutionConnector service uses to track this instance of the application execution. This is used as an argument to some of the other methods in this interface.
query execution status of an application

ul.li: executionId identifier of application to query

td.p: Returns message, containing various metadata, including status code.
register a listener to the progress of an application. the web interface of the listener will be called to notify it of execution events of this application

ul.li: executionId the id of the application to listen to
listenerEndpoint endpoint of the web service (must implement the {@link org.astrogrid.jes.delegate.v1.JobMonitor} interface

td.p: register a listener / consumer for the results of this application execution.

ul.li: executionId the id of the application to consume results from.
listenerEndpoint endpoint of the web service that will consume results (must implement the {@link org.astrogrid.jes.service.v1.cearesults.ResultsLIstener} interface)

td.p: return the registry entry for this common execution controller.

p.comment: A simple factory for creating CommonExecutionConnector Client delegates.

td.p: Create a CommonExecutionClientDelegate with the stated service endpoint

section.name: Workflow Document Model
section.p: Workflow Documents are represented using the following objects

p.comment: The abstract base class of all activities that can be performed in a workflow

td.p: Note: hashCode() has not been overriden
Returns the value of field 'id'. The field 'id' has the following description: used within the job execution system.
Sets the value of field 'id'. The field 'id' has the following description: used within the job execution system.

td.p: Note: hashCode() has not been overriden

p.comment: Action to take when an error occurs in the wrapped try block variable specified by 'var' attribute will contain details of the error.

td.p: Note: hashCode() has not been overriden
Returns the value of field 'activity'. The field 'activity' has the following description: Head of the substitution group
Returns the value of field 'var'. The field 'var' has the following description: name of the variable to define to contain the thrown error
Sets the value of field 'activity'. The field 'activity' has the following description: Head of the substitution group
Sets the value of field 'var'. The field 'var' has the following description: name of the variable to define to contain the thrown error

td.p: Note: hashCode() has not been overriden
Returns the value of field 'activity'. The field 'activity' has the following description: Head of the substitution group

p.comment: a collection of activities to be performed potentially in parallel

td.p: Note: hashCode() has not been overriden

p.comment: A for loop construct - iterated over a sequence of items

td.p: Note: hashCode() has not been overriden

Returns the value of field 'items'. The field 'items' has the following description: A sequence or iterator of items- the loop variable will be assigned to each in turn, and then loop body executed
